newsitem.title: INDIA: Oriental Bank 96/97 interest income up.
newsitem.headline: Oriental Bank 96/97 interest income up.

text.p: India's Oriental Bank of Commerce on Wednesday reported net income from interest of 12.50 billion rupees in 1996/97 (April-March), up from 11.27 billion in the previous financial year.
A company official told Reuters by telephone that the bank's expenditure in 1996/97 was 8.01 billion rupees, down from 9.54 billion in the previous year.
Earlier on Wednesday, a spokesman said the bank's net profit rose to 1.80 billion rupees in 1996/97 from 1.73 billion.b
Oriental Bank's other income climbed to 1.04 billion rupees in 1996/97 from 1.01 billion, while operating expenses fell to 2.53 billion rupees from 2.84 billion, the company official said.
The bank made a 1.2 billion rupee provision for contigency in 1996/997 as compared to 1.03 billion in 1995/96, he said.
The official said the provision included a tax payout of 660 million rupees, a provision of 520 million rupees for non-performing assets and 26 million rupees as depreciation on investments.
A formal statement from the bank was expected in coming days, the official said. ($1 = 35.8 rupees)
